intro: Sebastiania longispicata, commonly known as the long-hair sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes plants known for their milky sap and diverse morphological features. The plant is characterized by its attractive, palmate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural cultivation in warm climates.
